Posts.Content: Hi Backyard, I haven't had my appointment with oncologist yet and I don't know what an onco test is ? I'm under the Abertawe Bro Morgannwg health board. Good luck. Hazel.
Posts.Title: Age and Chemotherapy

Posts.Content: Hi G n' J Thanks for your info will wait to see what oncologist says but now I will have lots of questions to ask. Will let you know how I get on. Many thanks Hazel
Posts.Title: Age and Chemotherapy

Posts.Content: Had my Oncotype DX test back Monday which came back high risk so will be having chemo four treatments every three weeks. Was gutted when I found out as I'd convinced myself it was going to be low risk but trying to look at the positives and know I can stop the treatment at any time.  Hazel
Posts.Title: Age and Chemotherapy

Posts.Content: Hi Dreamthief  Thanks for info had my date through for start of my treatment today it's the 14th of the month so not long to wait now. Thinking of trying some hypnotherapy as I have a phobia about being sick, at my age. Hugs, Hazel xx
Posts.Title: Age and Chemotherapy

Posts.Content: Hi, I had the pathology result today from my surgery they managed to get all the cancer and it hadn't spread to the lymph nodes thankfully I'm set to have radiotherapy and hormone therapy as it was oestrogen positive. When I had the biopsies before surgery they believed it to be grade 2 but unfortunately it turned out to be grade 3. I'm due to see the oncologist in a couple of weeks to discuss whether I will be having chemo but my consultant was of the opinion that the oncologist may think that the side of chemo could outweigh the benefits due to my age of 73. Any thoughts on this please. Hazel x
Posts.Title: Age and Chemotherapy

Posts.Content: Hi Carolyn  Thanks for your advice regarding being a grown up my family sometimes wonder if I am !!!! Hugs to you  Hazel xx
Posts.Title: Age and Chemotherapy

Posts.Content: Hi Susanne, Thanks for the info will let you know the outcome of my appointment I had breast cancer five years ago and only needed radiotherapy and endometrial cancer 29 years ago. I have Lynch Syndrome which is a gene that predisposes me to many different cancers but you have to be positive and I plan to live a long life. Hazel
Posts.Title: Age and Chemotherapy

Posts.Content: Hi Debs, Thanks for your info I only know that it was a grade 3 er+ and 25.4mm. I had dcis 5 years ago and it was high grade and just had radiotherapy. I will ask lots of questions now I have lots of info and will let you know the outcome, and I can see a   Hugs Hazel xxx

Posts.Content: Hi Gay, My oncologist is also based at Velindre and he was really lovely as was his registrar. Thank you for your positive reply and useful  information I haven't really looked at the leaflets they gave me will leave that until next week once I have absorbed what's ahead. Hazel xxx

Posts.Content: Hi Dreamthief, Just looked properly on chemo leaflet and I will be having docetaxel and cyclophosphamide only got as far as that information that's enough for my head to absorb at the moment. Hugs, Hazel xx

Posts.Content: Hi Jfran, Thanks for your reply as I'm not Her2 positive I feel that they won't offer chemo my BCN said I'd be given Letrozole. Will soon know my fate. Hope you are well now. Hazel x

Posts.Content: Thanks CC and it certainly helps knowing there are so many who are. Take care Hazel
Posts.Title: Age and Chemotherapy

Posts.Content: Hi Gay, I'm also with Abertawe Bro Morgannwg trust and last time I had breast cancer had my radiotherapy at Velindre and they were really brilliant. It is very comforting hearing from all you lovely people with lots of good advice. Hazel xxx
Posts.Title: Age and Chemotherapy

Posts.Content: Hi G n' J I can't remember if it was mentioned how they would administer it think my head was elsewhere even though while waiting for results had prepared myself that it could be the result I didn't want. It does say all the ways you mentioned on the leaflet covering chemo I was given so they do have them in my health authority. My chemo drugs regime is T C. Feeling up and down at the moment but reading all the positive comments makes you realise you're not on your own. Hugs, Hazel xx
